definition: the return of a prodigal son (idiom)
wave/breaker/unrestrained/dissipated/to stroll/to ramble
(noun suffix)

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
to circle/to go back/to turn around/to answer/to return/to revolve/Hui ethnic group (Chinese Muslims)/time/classifier for acts of a play/section or chapter (of a classic book)
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
suffix for nouns
a prodigal son returned home is worth more than gold
pinyin: lang4 zi3 hui2 tou2 jin1 bu4 huan4

sentences.english: Our congregation has welcomed home many prodigals, all struggling to become spiritual adults.
sentences.chinese: 我們的教會曾歡迎不少在靈裏掙扎成長的浪子回頭。

sentences.english: We could say that he has turned his life around.
sentences.chinese: 我們可以說他已經浪子回頭了。

sentences.english: They welcomed the prodigal son home with open arms.
sentences.chinese: 他們張開雙臂來歡迎浪子回頭。

sentences.english: We felt this would be useful in making this final attempt to connect with some of the dark brothers, this change.
sentences.chinese: 我們再做最後的嘗試想要讓某些黑暗人士浪子回頭。

sentences.english: He also taught us the example of the Father in the Prodigal Son.
sentences.chinese: 他亦利用浪子回頭比喻中父親的榜樣來訓導我們。

sentences.english: So how to make Baidu again new collect the station of this return to the fold?
sentences.chinese: 那麼如何讓百度再重新收錄這個浪子回頭的站呢？

sentences.english: The prodigal son is too late.
The story of the Prodigal Son is a very good parable.
sentences.chinese: 浪子回頭的故事是一個很好的比喻。

definition: sighing voice, wailing breath (idiom)/to heave deep sighs/to sigh in despair
to mix/to blend/to dilute
to see, hear and obey (idiom); to take advice/to take sb at his word
authentic
mountain and river exhausted (idiom); at the end of the line/nowhere to go
to speak forcefully and with justice (idiom); to argue with the courage of one's convictions
to sleep peacefully (idiom)/(fig.) to rest easy/to be free of worries
to tease/to poke fun at
(idiom) (of a good outcome) unanticipated/serendipitous/fortuitous
unfair treatment/injustice
as to/considering/for
to ask oneself honestly/to search in one's heart
written polemics
virtue has its rewards (idiom); one good turn deserves another
self-taught/to learn without a teacher (idiom)
idle gossip
